turns.content: write me a few sentences to ask out Gabby on a second date.

"Hey Gabby, it was great catching up with you on our first date. I had a fantastic time getting to know you and I was wondering if you'd like to go on a second date with me. I'd love to spend more time with you and get to know you better. Let me know if you're free this weekend and we can plan something together."
include something about her clearly being the funniest friend

"Hey Gabby, I just wanted to reach out and say how much I enjoyed our first date. You were definitely the highlight of my week and I have been smiling ever since. I was also impressed by your quick wit and sense of humor. You have the unique ability to light up a room with your laughter, and I feel so lucky to have you as my friend. I'd love to continue this connection and explore more of what life has to offer. Would you be up for a second date with me this weekend?"

"Hey Gabby, hope you're doing well. I just wanted to reach out and say that I had a really good time on our first date. It was great getting to know you more. I was wondering if you're free sometime this week and maybe we could hang out again? No pressure, just looking forward to spending some more time together."
on the no pressure part - add something about there being no "Ryan or Brian" energy here and a no is more than ok

"Hey Gabby, hope you're doing well. I just wanted to touch base and say that I had a really enjoyable time on our first date. I'd love to see you again if you're up for it, but I completely understand if you're not interested. No pressure at all, I just wanted to ask. And no worries about any "Ryan or Brian" energy here, I promise! A simple "no" is more than okay, and I'll still consider you a friend either way."
you are sounding weird and formal - try agian casually

"Hey Gabby, hope you're doing well. I had a great time on our first date and I was thinking maybe we could do it again sometime this week. No pressure, just thought it'd be cool to hang out again. If not, no big deal, we can still be friends. Let me know what you think."
fine enough I guess, but ask for weekend

"Hey Gabby, hope you're having a good week. I had a blast on our first date and I was wondering if you're free this weekend? I'd love to grab some drinks or do something fun again. No pressure, just wanted to see if you're interested. Let me know, either way we can still be cool."
no drinks, suggest some activities in support of dry february specific to the city of Pittsrbugh

"Hey Gabby, hope you're doing well. I had a great time on our first date and I was thinking, since it's Dry February, we could do something fun in Pittsburgh this weekend that's not drink-related. Maybe we could check out the Carnegie Science Center or visit the Phipps Conservatory? Or even go for a hike in Frick Park? Let me know if you're free and we can make plans. No pressure, just thought it'd be a fun way to spend the weekend."
